Set Up the Requested Delivery Date Picker on the Checkout Page

In either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout, you can provide a date picker widget where a buyer can select a date for delivery. You can require a buyer to select a date, and you can validate the selected date, before the buyer is allowed to continue with checkout.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
NOTE
The date picker widget uses the bootstrap-datepicker.js library, included in the standard JavaScript libraries distributed with the managed package.
This library replaced the zebra_datepicker.js in B2B Commerce Summer ’18 (version 4.9). If you've migrated from a version that's older than Summer ’18, update the Date_Format page label to use the bootstrap-datepicker.js standard date format.
To customize the available dates in the date picker, extend the ccrz.cc_api_DeliveryDate extension point class in the B2B Commerce API. The ccrz.cc_api_DeliveryDate.getDeliveryDates method can return dates that are allowed or disallowed.
For LLI checkout, a buyer can request a different delivery date for each shipping group. You can specify whether the dates available for a particular shipping group depend on the group's specified shipping address. See step 7.

To manage the delivery date options on the Checkout page, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Shipping Options (3).
To enable the Requested Date Delivery widget, find the Show Request Date configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Shipping Options
Configuration	Show Request Date
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To ensure that a buyer selects an allowed date that the ccrz.cc_api_DeliveryDate.getDeliveryDates method specifies, find the Validate Delivery Date configuration (6). Make sure that its value is TRUE (7).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Shipping Options
Configuration	Validate Delivery Date
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Optionally, require a buyer to select a date from the Requested Delivery Date widget.
From the Modules picklist, select Payment Shipping (8).
Find the Request Delivery Date configuration (9), and make sure that its value is TRUE (10).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Payment Shipping
Configuration	Request Delivery Date
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Optionally, specify whether you want to filter the available dates for a shipping group in LLI checkout based on the group's specified shipping address.
From the Modules picklist, select Checkout (11).
Find the Address Based Requested Date configuration (12), and make sure that its value is TRUE (13).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Checkout
Configuration	Address Based Requested Date
Page	all
Value	TRUE
